conclusion: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life (Article 8 - Positive obligations;Article 8-1 - Respect for private life);Respondent State to take measures of a general character (Article 46-2 - Measures of a general character);Pecuniary damage - award;Non-pecuniary damage - award
docname: CASE OF L. v. LITHUANIA - [Russian Translation]
issue: Article 2.27 § 1 of the Civil Code 2000, Rule 109.2 of the Civil Registration Rules, Article 8 § 2 of the Residents Register Act, Article 5 of the Passport Act
scl: Christine Goodwin v. the United Kingdom [GC], no. 28957/95, ECHR 2002 VI, §§ 71- 93;D. v. the United Kingdom, judgment of 2 May 1997, Reports, §§ 51-54;Grant v. the United Kingdom, no. 32570/03, §§ 39-44, ECHR 2006;Mifsud v. France [GC] (déc.), no 57220/00, §§ 15-18, 11 September 2002;Pretty v. the United Kingdom, no. 2346/02, §§ 49-52, ECHR 2002 III;Stoeterij Zangersheide N.V. v. Belgium (déc.), no. 47295/99, 27 May 2004;Van Kück v. Germany, no. 35968/97, § 91, ECHR 2003 VII
